summary: NVIDIA reported a strong financial performance for the first quarter of fiscal 2024, with revenue reaching $7.19 billion, marking a 19% sequential increase but a 13% year-on-year decline. The growth was primarily driven by record data center revenue of $4.28 billion, which was up 18% sequentially and 14% year-on-year, fueled by the rising demand for accelerated computing, particularly in generative AI applications. The company is strategically focusing on expanding its data center capabilities and partnerships, including collaborations with major cloud service providers and enterprises to enhance its AI offerings. Looking ahead, NVIDIA expects total revenue for the second quarter to be around $11 billion, largely driven by continued demand for generative AI and large language models. However, the company acknowledged potential supply chain challenges that could impact growth in the latter half of the year. Notable updates included the introduction of the DGX Cloud offering, which aims to provide a high-performance computing stack for AI applications. Overall, while NVIDIA is well-positioned in a growing market, it faces risks related to competition and supply chain constraints.
key_highlights: Q1 revenue of $7.19 billion, up 19% sequentially but down 13% year-on-year.
Record data center revenue of $4.28 billion, driven by demand for accelerated computing and generative AI.
Expecting Q2 revenue to be around $11 billion, largely due to strong demand for generative AI.
Introduction of DGX Cloud offering to enhance AI computing capabilities.
Acknowledgment of potential supply chain challenges that may impact future growth.

kpis.name: Q1 Revenue
kpis.context: Q1 revenue was $7.19 billion, up 19% sequentially and down 13% year-on-year.

kpis.name: Data Center Revenue
kpis.context: Record data center revenue of $4.28 billion was up 18% sequentially and up 14% year-on-year.

kpis.name: Gaming Revenue
kpis.context: Gaming revenue of $2.24 billion was up 22% sequentially and down 38% year-on-year.

kpis.name: Pro Visualization Revenue
kpis.context: Pro Visualization revenue of $295 million was up 31% sequentially and down 53% year-on-year.

kpis.name: Automotive Revenue
kpis.context: Automotive revenue was $296 million, up 1% sequentially and up 114% from a year ago.

kpis.name: Expected Q2 Revenue
kpis.context: Total revenue is expected to be $11 billion, plus or minus 2% for Q2.

kpis.name: GAAP Gross Margin
kpis.context: GAAP gross margin is expected to be 68.6%, plus or minus 50 basis points.

kpis.name: Non-GAAP Gross Margin
kpis.context: Non-GAAP gross margin is expected to be 70%, plus or minus 50 basis points.

kpis.name: Operating Expenses (GAAP)
kpis.context: GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately $2.71 billion.

kpis.name: Operating Expenses (Non-GAAP)
kpis.context: Non-GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately $1.9 billion.

kpis.name: Shareholder Return
kpis.context: Returned $99 million to shareholders in the form of cash dividends.

kpis.name: Automotive Design Win Pipeline
kpis.context: Automotive design win pipeline over the next six years now stands at $14 billion.

risk_factors.description: Statements made during the call are based on current expectations and are subject to significant risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially.
The rapid growth in demand for generative AI could lead to supply chain challenges and affect the company's ability to meet customer needs.
Increased demand may invite more competition in terms of custom ASICs and other GPU solutions, potentially impacting market share.
The ability to sustain growth in data center sales may be limited by supply chain issues, affecting future revenue.

strategic_initiatives.initiative_name: Generative AI and Large Language Models
strategic_initiatives.progress: Driving a surge in demand across various sectors including consumer internet companies, CSPs, enterprises, and AI start-ups.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Extended data center visibility and increased revenue growth.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Supports and continuously patches over 4,000 software packages for enterprise deployment.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Facilitates secure and supported deployment of AI in various cloud and on-prem environments.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Started shipping the Hopper generation AI system for on-prem deployment.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Enables customers to leverage advanced AI capabilities in their operations.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Launched DGX Cloud through partnerships with Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Provides scalable AI solutions to a broader range of customers.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Increased pipeline to $14 billion, up from $11 billion a year ago.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Indicates strong future growth potential in the automotive sector.
